results.title: North-West Coastal Highway
results.brief_description: Shows how the Main Roads Department of Western Australia is completing a modern road from Carnarvon to Port Hedland as part of the National Highway number 1 encircling the continent. Explains some aspects of its effect on the development and prosperity of the area.

results.title: North
results.creator_credit: Christos Linou, Spiro Economopolous and Christos Tsiolkas
results.brief_description: Collingwood - ‘Hit the North. The north is where they put most of the wogs.’ Utilising excerpts from Christos Tsiolkas’ novel ‘Loaded’, ‘North’ is a lyrical and haunting work about space and place in Melbourne’s inner-city northern suburbs. This short work reveals a history of migrant alienation and regret submerged underneath the asphalt, mortar and concrete of the modern Australian city.

results.title: Normandy
results.brief_description: Normandy has an exciting past of conquest and liberation and is now a popular holiday destination. This tape takes in sights such as; the port of Dieppe, Mont St Michel, a cruise down the River Seine to the city of Rouen, Monet’s gardens at Giverny, the streets of Bayeaux, the countryside surrounding the Suisse Normande, the harbour at Honfleur, and on a more historical note visit the D-Day landing beaches and Caen, where William the Conqueror lies entombed.

results.title: Normandie-Niemen
results.creator_credit: Damir Viatich Berejnykh, Jean Dreville and Simon Mariakhine
results.brief_description:
In 1942, 16 French pilots decide to join forces with the Red Army and participate in the Battle of Stalingrad.

Credits: Producer, Simon Mariakhine ; directors, Jean Dreville, Damir Viatich Berejnykh ; writers, Charles Spaak, Elsa Triolet, Constantin Simonov ; photography, Jacques Natteau ; music, Rodeon Stchedrine.
Cast: Marc Cassot, Giani Esposito, Pierre Trabaud, Gerald Buhr, Georges Riviere.

results.title: Norman the doorman (K)
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Story of Norman the Doorman who lives in the basement of the art museum and faithfully guards the mousehole doorway to the museum. Norman makes a wire sculpture out of mousetraps and enters a sculpture contest in the museum. When he wins, Norman’s prize is a tour through the upstairs galleries.

results.title: Norman McLaren: Selected films. Creative process (Collectors edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, Karen Marginson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This collector’s edition DVD box set features 14 of famed filmmaker Norman McLaren’s animated works; a documentary entitled ‘Creative Process: Norman McLaren’ which explores his philosophy on cinema and creativity; and a companion 104 page booklet in French and English that contains technical notes on the featured films and extends the ideas espoused in ‘Creative Process’. The documentary and many of the featured films are also available on other formats in the ACMI collection.

results.title: Norman Loves Rose
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Basil Appleby, Norman Films and Direct Hit Productions
results.brief_description: Norman is a sensitive, precocious 13 year old preparing for his formal entry into Jewish manhood, the bar mitzvah. He is also passionately in love with his sister-in-law, Rose, who is pregnant. Stars Carol Kane, Tony Owen with Barry Otto, Sandy Gore and Warren Mitchell.

results.title: Norman Jewison, filmmaker
results.creator_credit: Douglas Jackson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Toronto-born Norman Jewison first gained prominence producing for Canadian television, then went on to greater success making Hollywood theatrical features. In this film he is seen directing a large international cast and crew in the film version of the musical hit Fiddler on the Roof. Between scenes, Jewison talks freely about many aspects of the film industry and some of his experiences in it. A candid study of a director in action.

results.title: Norman Gunston at Gough Whitlam's dismissal
results.brief_description: Within earshot of the deposed Prime Minister, Gunston improvised a mock-serious question that took the pulse of a nation: “…is this an affront to the Constitution of this country or…just a stroke of good luck for Mr Fraser?”.

constellations_other.name: Dismissing the truth
constellations_other.description: The dismissal of Gough Whitlam by Governor-General Sir John Kerr is one of the most controversial moments in Australian politics. Whitlam’s rebuttal imploring the electorate to ‘maintain the rage’ was immortalised on TV and took on the gravitas of Shakespearean tragedy.

results.description: Inserting himself among the throng of politicians gathered outside Parliament House as events unfolded, TV personality Norman Gunston – the satirical alter ego of Australian actor and comedian Garry McDonald – added an element of the surreal to the tumultuous proceedings as he attempted to elicit comments from Labor personalities including Bob Hawke – who waved him away with a dismissive ‘ah look, it’s a bit too serious for that’ – and a befuddled Bill Hayden. Within earshot of the deposed Prime Minister, Gunston turned to the large crowd gathered and, staying in character, improvised a mock-serious question that took the pulse of a nation: “…is this an affront to the Constitution of this country or…just a stroke of good luck for Mr Fraser?”.
description_for_label: Inserting himself among the throng of politicians gathered outside Parliament House as events unfolded, TV personality Norman Gunston – the satirical alter ego of Australian actor and comedian Garry McDonald – added an element of the surreal to the tumultuous proceedings as he attempted to elicit comments from Labor personalities including Bob Hawke – who waved him away with a dismissive ‘ah look, it’s a bit too serious for that’ – and a befuddled Bill Hayden. Within earshot of the deposed Prime Minister, Gunston turned to the large crowd gathered and, staying in character, improvised a mock-serious question that took the pulse of a nation: “…is this an affront to the Constitution of this country or…just a stroke of good luck for Mr Fraser?”.
